isis.stitle: SPRING ASSEMBLIES AND SHOCK ABSORBERS - DISASSEMBLE

note.para: If only the spring eye bushing is to be replaced, position spring in shop press to remove bushing. If a press is not available, follow step 1 below. If the complete spring assembly is going to be disassembled, remove bushing. After spring has been disassembled, it is easier to handle the spring leaf.

step1.para: Clamp the spring end in a vise and remove the old bushing from the spring eye to disassemble spring.
Reposition the spring assembly in a vise so that it is clamped near its center.
If bolted-type rebound clips are used, remove the nuts, bolts and spacers.
If clinch-type rebound clips are used, bend the clip tabs up, being careful not to break them.

note.para: Heat clinch-type rebound clips with a torch to help avoid breaking them.

step1.para: Remove the retaining nut from the spring center bolt.
Release the vise, letting the spring leaves separate. Remove the spring assembly from the vise, and remove the center bolt from the leaves.
